snippet: Requests for recusal in Supreme Court cases cannot be left solely to the justice involved. They need to be reviewed by other justices.
abstract: Editorial urges the Supreme Court to change the way that it handles requests for recusal; cites a federal appeals court ruling in the case of federal trial Judge Loren Smith that illustrates why recusal over a conflict of interest cannot be left solely to the judge involved.
lead_paragraph: Requests for recusal in Supreme Court cases cannot be left solely to the justice involved. They need to be reviewed by other justices.
